title: Implement PRD pipeline with async human Q&A via subtasks
description:
Create an automated PRD pipeline that:

1. **Idea Intake**: Picks up ideas assigned to 'prd-pipeline' via `bd ready --assignee prd-pipeline`

2. **Async Q&A via Subtasks**: Instead of interactive interviews, the pipeline:
   - Reads the idea description
   - Uses prd/PRD-PROMPT.md to generate discovery questions
   - Creates subtasks for each question (assigned to a human)
   - Human answers questions by updating the subtask description or adding comments
   - Human closes subtask when answered
   - Pipeline waits for all Q&A subtasks to close (uses dependency blocking)

3. **PRD Generation**: Once all Q&A subtasks are closed:
   - Collects answers from subtasks
   - Generates PRD document to prd/PRD-[name].md using prd/PRD-PROMPT.md
   - Explodes PRD into implementation tasks/epics assigned to 'ralph'
   - Closes the original idea

**Scripts needed**:
- `prd-pipeline.sh` - Loop that runs `bd ready --assignee prd-pipeline`

**Workflow**:
```
Human creates idea (assignee: prd-pipeline)
    ↓
prd-pipeline.sh picks it up
    ↓
Creates Q&A subtasks (assignee: human, blocks: idea)
    ↓
Human answers async, closes subtasks
    ↓
Pipeline detects all Q&A done
    ↓
Generates PRD using prd/PRD-PROMPT.md, explodes to tasks (assignee: ralph)
    ↓
ralph.sh picks up implementation work
```
